comment_data.body: Can you please elaborate what exactly is displayed incorrectly, including pressed keys and terminal size required to reproduce it? I doubt this has anything to do with `vim.ui_attach()`, so figuring out what exactly causes a display issue would be helpful. Probably just the presence of floating windows?
Yes, I can reproduce corrupted screen states in the presence of a mere floating window (fixed by pressing \<C-L>).
Yeah it is more likely related to the compositor (where we emulate scrolls in case of overlapping windows)

I tried to narrow down individual problematic characters, one example is ‡∏™‡∏≥ (U+0E2A U+0E33). This is considered to be a single cell by neovim as we use extended grapheme clusters, but many terminals still use legacy grapheme clusters.

we need to extend the workaround in `print_cell_at_pos()` to also handle such cases.

title: TUI: scroll issue with floating windows and extended grapheme clusters
